title: Why rural is becoming the new urban for consumer business - The Economic Times
summary:
Rural Areas: The New Frontier for Consumer Demand in India

Date: 2023-10-10 Source: Economic Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Grameen Bharat Mahotsav 2025, highlighting the growing role of prosperous villages in India's development. The article discusses the narrowing rural-urban consumption gap, with rural demand currently outpacing urban market growth.

Key Points

  • Rural consumer demand is increasing rapidly, surpassing urban areas.
  • Dabur India reported rural volume growth exceeding urban growth for the fourth consecutive quarter.
  • Demand in rural India grew by 6%, compared to 2.8% in urban areas.
  • The average Monthly Per Capita Consumption Expenditure (MPCE) in rural India increased 9.2% to Rs 4,122.
  • Rural poverty fell to less than 5% for the first time, helping to drive consumption growth.
"The knowledge asymmetry that used to exist between urban and rural is virtually gone," said Lakshmi Venu, director of TAFE.

With the improving dynamics in rural areas, consumer patterns are evolving, indicating a shift away from basic necessities.

Conclusion

The ongoing trend of rural consumption growth suggests significant implications for consumer goods companies, which may need to adapt their strategies to cater to the emerging rural market.
newTitle: Rural Areas: The New Frontier for Consumer Demand in India

title: Man urinates on sleeping passenger on flight; ‘disgusting’ response from airline leaves kin in shock | Today News - Mint
summary:
Man Urinates on Sleeping Passenger on Flight; ‘Disgusting’ Response from United Airlines Leaves Kin in Shock

Date: [Publication Date], Source: Live Mint

Jerome Gutierrez was asleep on a United Airlines flight from San Francisco to Manila when another passenger urinated on him. The airline's response, providing only a change of clothes and preventing Gutierrez from approaching the offender, has been criticized as inadequate and disgusting by his stepdaughter, Nicole Cornell.

  1. United Airlines passenger urinates on sleeping man
  2. Airlines provide only a change of clothes and prevent victim from confronting offender
  3. Incident goes viral, reminiscent of 2023 Air India ‘pee-gate’

“They put the needs of the airline before my stepdad’s health. I am so disgusted and in shock with how United Airlines handled this! That is a biohazard, and the plane should’ve turned around to address this issue.” - Nicole Cornell

United Airlines confirmed the incident and banned the passenger but has not provided further details.

Conclusion: The incident has sparked outrage and discussions on social media, highlighting the need for better passenger behavior and airline response to such incidents.
newTitle: Passenger Urinates on Sleeping Man, United Airlines' Handling Criticized

title: Indians' consumption of pulses, cereals declines by 5 pc as spending pattern shifts: SBI Report - The Economic Times
summary:
Indians' consumption of pulses, cereals declines by 5 pc as spending pattern shifts: SBI Report

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Indian households have significantly altered their spending patterns over the past 12 years, shifting focus from food to non-food items, according to an analysis by the State Bank of India (SBI).

  • Consumption of cereals and pulses has declined by over 5% in both rural and urban areas.
  • Spending on food items in rural areas decreased from 52.9% in 2011-12 to 47.04% in 2023-24.
  • Urban areas saw a reduction in food spending from 42.62% to 39.68%.
  • Non-food expenditure increased, with rural areas rising from 47.1% to 52.96% and urban areas from 57.38% to 60.32%.
  • Increased spending on toiletries is linked to hygiene awareness and initiatives like Swachh Bharat Abhiyan.
This transformation highlights the dynamic nature of India's consumption behavior and its alignment with global trends.

The shift from food to non-food spending points to India's evolving socio-economic landscape, where rising incomes and improved living standards drive consumer priorities.
newTitle: Indians Shift Spending from Food to Non-Food Items, Reports SBI

title: Kirloskar Oil Engines file appeal before SAT challenging SEBI order to disclose family settlement deed | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Kirloskar Oil Engines Appeals SEBI Order on Family Settlement Disclosure

Date: December 31, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Kirloskar Industries Ltd has filed an appeal challenging a SEBI order requiring disclosure of a family settlement deed.

  • The appeal was made to the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) against SEBI's directive.
  • SEBI's order dates back to December 30, 2024, and concerns a deed dated September 11, 2009.
  • The existence of the deed's binding nature on Kirloskar companies is under litigation since 2018.
  • Kirloskar Industries claims SEBI's decision contains inaccuracies and disregards legal principles.
“The question of whether the DFS is binding on the Kirloskar companies is pending before the Civil Court since 2018, and despite this SEBI has opined on matters that are sub-judice.”

This appeal highlights ongoing legal disputes and the complexities surrounding corporate regulations.
newTitle: Kirloskar Oil Engines Appeals SEBI Order on Family Settlement Disclosure

Avoid Tax Hassles: Your comprehensive guide to income tax proof submission for 2024-25 | Mint - Mint
summary:
Avoid Tax Hassles: Your comprehensive guide to income tax proof submission for 2024-25

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

The submission of income tax investment proofs for FY 2024-25 is essential for accurate tax computations and rebate claims. Employees must declare their investments at the start of the year, with finance teams collecting and verifying proofs as the year ends.

Common Investment Proofs

  • Life Insurance Premium Receipts
  • Public Provident Fund (PPF) Passbook/Statement
  • National Savings Certificates (NSC)
  • Tax-saving Fixed Deposits
  • National Pension Scheme (NPS) Contribution Receipts
  • Home Loan Interest Payment Proofs
  • Rent Receipts for HRA Claims
  • Tuition Fees for Children

Format of Submission

Investment proofs may be emailed or submitted in hard copy, as per employer procedure. Ensure documents are clear and complete.

Late Submission Consequences

Late submissions may lead to higher tax deductions and missed refunds.

Investment Proof Submission Guide

  1. Ensure copies of investment documents are ready.
  2. Mutual fund statements must include investor name, PAN, and portfolio value.
  3. Highlight maturity details for physical documents.
  4. Proof amounts should match claimed deductions.

Income Tax Rebate and Savings

Employees can claim deductions under sections 80C, 80D, 80G, and others with valid proofs.

Section 80C

Claim up to Rs. 1.5 lakh in deductions with various investments.

Section 80 CCD

Additional deduction of ₹50,000 on NPS investments.

Section 80G

Tax deductions available for contributions to relief funds.

Section 80D

Deductions on health insurance premiums based on age.

Read all personal finance stories here
newTitle: Avoid Tax Hassles: A Guide to Income Tax Proof Submission for 2024-25

title: IPO tussle: Which countries saw the maximum number of new issues in 2024? - The Economic Times
summary:
IPO Tussle: Which Countries Saw the Maximum Number of New Issues in 2024?

Date: Jan 04, 2025

Source: ETMarkets.com

In 2024, a total of 1,145 IPOs were recorded globally, a slight decrease from 1,271 in the previous year. The data highlights the top countries leading in IPO activity.

  • India led Asia with 90 mainboard IPOs and 178 SME IPOs, raising Rs 1.6 lakh crore.
  • China followed closely with 101 IPOs, where companies raised nearly $9 billion.
  • Japan's Exchange Group recorded 93 IPOs, the third highest in Asia.
  • Hong Kong had 66 companies going public, marking the fourth highest number of IPOs.
  • The US exchanges, Nasdaq and NYSE, while not leading in the number of IPOs, raised significant capital ($16.5 billion and $15.9 billion respectively).
“The primary market has been a solid platform for companies to raise funds globally and the numbers in 2024 prove that.” – ETMarkets.com

This data reflects the ongoing global dynamics in the IPO markets, showing both regional leadership and the varying amounts of capital raised across countries.
newTitle: IPO Tussle: Leading Countries for New Issues in 2024
